intro: Stellera ganpi, commonly known as the mountain starwort, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Stellera ganpi is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
